topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Deploy the OVS Bridge Patch 1

body.p: HCG-ovs patch fixes the buffer overflow in versions 2.2.x through 2.3.x allows for Remote Code Execution, and in 2.4.0 - 2.4.8 allows for Denial of Service and possible RCE. Because these packets are picked up by OVS before reaching alternate filtering mechanisms such as iptables, which renders on-host controls ineffective. It is confirmed that sending this traffic to an API endpoint will allow malicious behavior.
Prerequisites: - ovs-bridge patch is applied already on lifecycle manager host.

section.title: Deploy the OVS Security Patch for the lifecycle manager host

ol.li: Log into the lifecycle manager host using your credentials.

Copy the patch files to the in ~/ directory:
openvswitch-common_2.4.90-1+hlinux2_amd64.deb
openvswitch-switch_2.4.90-1+hlinux2_amd64.debupdate-ovs-switch.sh
Login into the lifecycle manager host through iLO console

Shutdown all the running VMs.
In case of KVM cluster move all the running VMs on the other KVM.
Execute the following to upgrade openvswitch-common dpkg -i ~/openvswitch-common_2.4.90-1+hlinux2_amd64.deb
Execute the following command to stop the openvswitch service service openvswitch-switch stop
Execute the following the command to upgrade openvswitch-switch dpkg -i ~/openvswitch-switch_2.4.90-1+hlinux2_amd64.debIn some cases you might see failure messages which can be ignored.
Execute the following script to update the openvswitch-switch command source ~/update-ovs-switch.sh
Execute the following command to run system daemon reload systemctl daemon-reload
Execute the following command to start the openvswitch service service openvswitch-switch start
Start all the VMs that were shutdown. In case of KVM cluster move back the VMs that where previously moved, then repeat the process to update the other KVM(s).

Once the HOS controller VMs are up, restore MySQL by running the below commands:hlm stop -c <cloud name> -t FND-MDB hlm start -c <cloud name> -t FND-MDB For more information, see Restart MySQL and RabbitMQ to make sure MySQL and RabbitMQ services are running.

section.title: Deploy the OVS Security Patch for the lifecycle manager VM

ol.li: On the lifecycle manager host, copy the patch files to the /var/hlm/clouds/<cloudname>/patches directory.
Execute following command to apply the patch:hlm patch -c <cloud-name> -n HCG-ovs -t <tier> For example: hlm patch -c <cloud-name> -n HCG-ovs -t localhost
